tagline: 5 days. 5 stages. The Grand Tour of American Gravel.

course.terrain_type: High desert and forest service gravel across Central Oregon
course.terrain_surface: Variable—smooth forest roads to chunky volcanic gravel
course.signature_challenge: The cumulative nature. Any single stage is manageable. Five consecutive days of 60-80+ miles with major climbing is a different animal.
course.character: Five distinct stages showcasing Oregon's diversity—high desert, forests, mountains, and everything between.

suffering_zones.label: Opening Salvo
suffering_zones.desc: 60+ miles to set the tone. Fresh legs meet Oregon reality.

suffering_zones.label: The Queen Stage
suffering_zones.desc: The longest, hardest day. Where GC hopes live or die.

suffering_zones.label: Final Test
suffering_zones.desc: Tired bodies, one more day. Celebrate or suffer to the end.

course.climate_description: Late June brings long days, warm temps, and Oregon's classic high desert conditions

biased_opinion.summary: Oregon Trail is for those who find single-day races limiting. The stage format creates different demands—recovery, consistency, pacing across days. It's closer to bikepacking than racing, with timing chips.

logistics.parking: Vehicle support recommended for gear transport between stages.

searchable_text: Oregon Trail Gravel Grinder 5 days. 5 stages. The Grand Tour of American Gravel. Five distinct stages showcasing Oregon's diversity—high desert, forests, mountains, and everything between. The cumulative nature. Any single stage is manageable. Five consecutive days of 60-80+ miles with major climbing is a different animal.
